intro: Chamaesyce meyeniana, commonly known as the Mexican sandmat, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Mexico. Chamaesyce meyeniana is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
